attributes.action: Allow a parent with FULL CUSTODY to travel abroad for up to 28 days.
attributes.additional_details: The English law allows a parent with FULL CUSTODY/RESIDENCY ORDER to travel for up to 28 days without seeking permission from anyone with parental responsibilities & the Scottish law I believe needs to mirror this. Thank you.
attributes.background: In my particular case I have a custody order. My children's father has bail conditions set where he can only see his children through a supervised contact centre, his trial with serious charges is pending, all communication is via solicitors & he does not willingly financially support his children.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

You may be able to start a petition to the Scottish Parliament about this. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: 

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
